software_engineer.name: Software Engineer
software_engineer.description: Design, develop, and maintain software applications and systems

example_contexts.math: Algorithms use mathematical concepts like logarithms to optimize search operations
example_contexts.physics: Graphics engines apply physics principles for realistic simulations
example_contexts.chemistry: Computational chemistry software models molecular interactions

data_scientist.name: Data Scientist
data_scientist.description: Extract insights from data using statistical analysis and machine learning

example_contexts.math: Linear algebra powers machine learning algorithms and neural networks
example_contexts.statistics: Hypothesis testing validates whether patterns in data are significant
example_contexts.biology: Bioinformatics analyzes genetic sequences to identify disease markers

doctor.name: Doctor/Surgeon
doctor.description: Diagnose and treat patients using medical knowledge and procedures

example_contexts.biology: Understanding cellular respiration helps diagnose metabolic disorders
example_contexts.chemistry: Pharmacology relies on chemical reactions to develop effective medications
example_contexts.physics: MRI machines use magnetic resonance to create detailed body scans

biomedical_engineer.name: Biomedical Engineer
biomedical_engineer.description: Design medical devices and systems combining biology with engineering

example_contexts.physics: Ultrasound imaging uses wave physics to visualize internal organs
example_contexts.biology: Artificial organs require deep understanding of biological systems
example_contexts.math: Differential equations model blood flow through cardiac devices

mechanical_engineer.name: Mechanical Engineer
mechanical_engineer.description: Design and build mechanical systems from engines to robots

example_contexts.physics: Newton's laws govern the motion of mechanical linkages in robots
example_contexts.math: Calculus optimizes engine efficiency by modeling combustion processes
example_contexts.chemistry: Material properties determine which alloys work best for components

astrophysicist.name: Astrophysicist
astrophysicist.description: Study celestial objects and the fundamental laws of the universe

example_contexts.physics: General relativity explains how massive objects bend spacetime
example_contexts.math: Differential equations predict planetary orbits and satellite trajectories
example_contexts.chemistry: Stellar spectroscopy reveals the chemical composition of stars

neuroscientist.name: Neuroscientist
neuroscientist.description: Research the brain and nervous system to understand cognition and behavior

example_contexts.biology: Action potentials transmit signals between neurons in milliseconds
example_contexts.chemistry: Neurotransmitters like dopamine regulate mood and motivation
example_contexts.physics: fMRI uses magnetic fields to map brain activity during tasks

financial_analyst.name: Financial Analyst
financial_analyst.description: Analyze financial data to guide investment and business decisions

example_contexts.math: Compound interest calculations determine investment growth over time
example_contexts.statistics: Regression analysis predicts stock price movements
example_contexts.economics: Supply and demand curves explain market price fluctuations

lawyer.name: Lawyer
lawyer.description: Advocate for clients and interpret laws in legal proceedings

example_contexts.history: Constitutional law evolved from historical precedents like Marbury v. Madison
example_contexts.economics: Antitrust law prevents monopolies that harm market competition
example_contexts.government: Separation of powers ensures checks and balances in legal systems

environmental_scientist.name: Environmental Scientist
environmental_scientist.description: Study environmental problems and develop solutions for sustainability

example_contexts.biology: Ecosystem dynamics show how species interact in food webs
example_contexts.chemistry: Carbon cycle explains how greenhouse gases trap heat
example_contexts.math: Population models predict species decline from habitat loss

chemical_engineer.name: Chemical Engineer
chemical_engineer.description: Design processes to convert raw materials into valuable products

example_contexts.chemistry: Catalysts speed up reactions in industrial chemical production
example_contexts.math: Rate equations optimize yield in pharmaceutical manufacturing
example_contexts.physics: Heat transfer principles design efficient chemical reactors

architect.name: Architect
architect.description: Design buildings and structures that are functional and aesthetic

example_contexts.math: Geometry determines load-bearing angles in building foundations
example_contexts.physics: Structural forces must be calculated to prevent building collapse
example_contexts.art: Golden ratio creates aesthetically pleasing architectural proportions

economist.name: Economist
economist.description: Analyze production, distribution, and consumption of goods and services

example_contexts.math: Elasticity measures how demand changes with price variations
example_contexts.statistics: Time series analysis forecasts unemployment trends
example_contexts.government: Fiscal policy uses government spending to stabilize economies

pharmacist.name: Pharmacist
pharmacist.description: Dispense medications and advise on their safe and effective use

example_contexts.chemistry: Molecular structure determines how drugs bind to receptors
example_contexts.biology: Understanding metabolism helps predict drug half-life in the body
example_contexts.math: Dosage calculations ensure safe medication amounts by body weight
